text: The leader of Skeggi is one, if not the most powerful human on the Lustrian continent.
A Skeggi loyal to one leader would surely shift the tides of destiny in the New World.
They smell horrid, yet the Jarl's of Skeggi swear by Soren's potions and blessings.
It is said even her blades and daggers whisper the names of those they are destined to kill.
Jarl Sammi strangled Losteriksson and took over Skeggi centuries ago, he declared the Jungle the enemy and was expertly skilled in slaying Lizardmen.
The jungle raids have taught the Skeggi all there is about the feral beasts that stalk these lands.
Not to be underestimated as both a sorceress and a warrior, Adella's totem is one of many faces.
What the Skeggi marauders lack in intelligence they make up in sheer ruthlessness.
Blóm, which means flower - is Adella's pet and steed. She fed it poisonous continously as part of her experiments which caused it to deform and mutate.
Trinkets blessed by Tzeentch seemingly appear at random on the trails set out for her by her many mouths.
She who follows the ways of Tzeentch may recieve his fruitful boons.
Weapon Strength: %+n% for Corrupted Lizard units
Thousand Whispers: Adella may directly face monsters within the arcanum
Master Temptator: Sargath may directly face monsters within the arcanum
The Jungle King: Chaos Touched feral creatures are drawn to Skeggi's banner when Monogod corruption is high
Lots of talks and whispers yet little to show for it..
Defeated ''King'' Adella of the Thousand Mouths

A magic sword which ignores both armour and the protective scaly skin of the Lizardmen when it strikes. It is said the vitkis of Skeggi chanted unholy incantations for seven days straight without the slightest interruption before it was deemed satisfactory by King Adella.

In the heart of Lustria's dense jungle, Adella of the Thousand Mouths, a Norscan Queen gifted with chaotic whispers, seeks the legendary "Sword of Warping" to unleash chaos against the Lizardmen. With a cadre of loyal marauders, she ventures inland for the final quest battle, the jungle humming with anticipation as Adella prepares to seize the Sword and face the cold-blooded defenders in a decisive struggle that will echo through the ancient jungle.
Adella of the Thousand Mouths is the ''King'' of Skeggi and devote servant of Tzeentch. The thousand holes across her body whisper her Masters sinister plans - which she tries to bring to fruition.
Adella of the Thousand Mouths, ''King'' of Skeggi, plots and schemes in Tzeentch's name as her mouths whisper sinister plans to dominate all of Lustria.
A magical sword crafted from the essence of slain Cold Ones with the power to cut through any armour or scaled skin.
King Adella of Skeggi is blessed by Tzeentch with thousands of half-inch holes which feed her with sinister plans and whispers.
An astonishingly large Giant, the people of Skeggi where quick to name him after Jarl Fishbrain the Red - seeing his strength as a resemblence. The only, one might add.
Blóm, which means flower - is Adella's pet and steed. She fed it poisonous continously as part of her experiments which caused it to deform and mutate.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
The thousand holes across her body whisper her Masters sinister plans - which Adella tries to bring to fruition.

Adella of the Thousand Mouths, the imposing female ruler of Skeggi, commands both fear and respect among her subjects. Standing at an impressive eight feet tall, her formidable presence is matched only by her cunning intellect and devious nature. Adella bears the unmistakable mark of Tzeentch's favor, with thousands of whispering holes peppering her flesh, a constant reminder of her connection to the Chaos God of change and intrigue. With a cruel streak and a penchant for public displays of brutality, Adella rules with an iron fist, using manipulation and division to maintain her grip on power. As the whispers of her mutation echo her every move, Adella navigates the treacherous political landscape of Skeggi, ever vigilant against potential threats to her throne.

Amidst the frigid wastes of Norsca, where the bitter winds howl and the icy tundra stretches endlessly, lies the Icefang tribe, a group of Norscans touched by the icy grip of Chaos itself. Among them, Drenok Johansen was born, destined for a life of hardship and strife.Driven by a fierce determination, Drenok embarked on a quest to uncover the secrets of his father's past. Through blizzards and biting cold, he journeyed across the frozen expanse of Norsca, his mind consumed by thoughts of vengeance and redemption.It was in the depths of the frozen wilderness that Drenok's path finally crossed with that of his father, now a twisted reflection of the man he once was, consumed by the malevolent influence of Chaos. In a clash of steel and sorcery, father and son confronted each other, their battle echoing across the icy landscape.

In the icy wastes of Norsca, amidst the ruins of his fallen tribe, Einarr Steelfist stands as a towering figure of vengeance and resilience. Marked by the Raven God and driven by a burning desire for revenge, he embarks on a perilous quest deep into the Chaos Wastes, seeking to reclaim an arcane treasure from the clutches of the Plague God Nurgle. With each step, he gathers followers from all corners of Chaos, forging a disparate band united in their thirst for retribution.Einarr is a towering figure, a giant among men, with muscles rippling beneath fur-wrapped armor, and a broad-bladed sword gripped tightly in his powerful hands. His pale eyes, colder than the frozen wastes he traverses, shine with an unyielding determination as he faces every obstacle in his path. Bedecked in the spoils of his conquests, he carries the weight of his fallen kin upon his shoulders, his resolve unbroken even in the face of insurmountable odds.

Akkorak the Crow, feared and revered, rides into battle atop his Chaos Steed, lance held high and towering shields at the ready. Known as the "Butcher of Teska" and the "Reaver of the Nine Wastes," he commands a legion of formidable Chaos Knights who dare to challenge him on horseback. In the tumult of war, he has never known defeat, his skill in combat matched only by his unyielding devotion to the Dark Gods.

Harald Whyrlas, the colossal leader of the Graeling Tribe, stands as a towering figure among Norscans, wielding a greatsword that dwarfs even the stoutest warriors. His ambition is singular and formidable: to forge a unified kingdom from the disparate Norscan tribes, casting aside the petty squabbles of gods and men alike in pursuit of a grander vision. Unlike his chaotic brethren, Harald eschews the whims of the Dark Gods, instead seeking to unite his people through diplomacy or brute force, sparing little mercy for those who stand in his path toward a united North.

Birna, the Sarl huntress, possesses a mesmerizing allure that belies her fierce and independent spirit. With platinum hair cascading down her back and dark eyes that betray a depth of wisdom, she commands attention wherever she roams. Yet, beneath the surface of her captivating beauty lies a warrior's heart, marked by the grey scars of battles fought and won. Gifted by the gods with a tongue as dark as a crow's feather, she wields a unique power to communicate with the creatures of the sky, calling upon them to aid her in times of need. Clad in leather and chain, with a sword at her side and a bow in hand, she moves with the grace of a predator through the wilderness, her every step a whisper upon the wind.

Sayl the Faithless, known as the "Twisted Seer of the Wastes," is a cunning arch-sorcerer of the Dolgan tribe, renowned for his mastery of deception and dark sorcery. From the harsh Eastern Steppes, Sayl's path to power is marked by betrayal and manipulation, as he outwits rivals and kin alike to ascend to dominance.As an apprentice to the powerful shaman-sorcerer Schalkain the Vile, Sayl sowed seeds of discord among his peers, orchestrating betrayals that led to his own rise. Unbound by allegiance to any single Chaos God, Sayl's loyalties shift with the winds of opportunity, his alliances forged and broken to serve his insatiable ambition. Feared and hated by his own people, Sayl's reign is fraught with peril, as enemies, mortal and Daemon alike, seek his downfall. Yet, amidst the chaos, he remains a formidable war-leader, his mastery over the unholy storms of the northern wastes making the Dolgan tribe under his sway a force to be reckoned with.

High King Ulfric Grondal, leader of the Bjornling Tribe, stands as a beacon of defiance against the chaotic tides that ravage the north. Unlike his brethren who embrace the dark gifts of Chaos, Ulfric holds steadfast to the gods of men, fostering diplomacy and trade with the realms beyond. Under his rule, the Bjornlings thrive as adaptable warriors and shrewd merchants, renowned for their prowess at sea and their willingness to forge alliances in times of peace. From the fortified stronghold of Skjold, Ulfric Grondal guides his people with wisdom and strength, charting a course between war and commerce in the tumultuous lands of the north.

[[col:red]]This Regiment of Renown will unlock only if you ally or Confederate the Skeggi Tribe or have Adella of the Thousand Mouths in your faction[[/col]]

[[col:red]]This Regiment of Renown will unlock only if you complete the quest battle if you're a Skeggi faction, otherwise, you have to ally or Confederate the Skeggi Tribe or have Adella of the Thousand Mouths in your faction[[/col]]
Touched by the Blood God these mighty beasts are wild and untamed with a bloodthirsty appetite for violence.
Touched by the Earthfather this Bastiladon moves slower, yet their hide as mutated to a thick pestering substenance.
Touched by the God of Excess this Bastiladon moves at unnatural speed, marauding about the battlefield.
The ultimate Changer has corrupted this Bastiladon, granting it his magical essence and thirst for change.
Touched by Khorne this feral beasts cry the sound of destruction; finally, carnage is unleashed.
Nurgle has blessed this mighty beast with a hide that's both festering with rot and impregnable at the same time.
Radiant and rapid. These creatures touched by Slaanesh leave his mark on any battlefield.
When Tzeentch wills it, magic often linger among the clouds.
The Dodvakt - or Deathkeepers - were formed when the Norscan settlement of Skeggi was under undead threat. A elite unit of Skeggi warriors who still defend the coastal town to this day.
As the Monolith of Jarl Fishbrain lumbers about the battlefield the many trinkets and treasures he was gifted drop down, causing marauders to flock around him in search of coin.
